sn55.53:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn55.53:1.2: Then the lay follower Dhammadinna, together with five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn55.53:1.4: and instruct us. It will be for our lasting welfare and happiness.”
sn55.53:2.1: “So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:
sn55.53:2.2: ‘From time to time we will undertake and dwell upon the discourses spoken by the Realized One that are deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness.’
sn55.53:2.3: That’s how you should train yourselves.”
sn55.53:2.4: “Sir, we live at home with our children, using sandalwood imported from Kāsi, wearing garlands, perfumes, and makeup, and accepting gold and money.
sn55.53:2.5: It’s not easy for us to undertake and dwell from time to time upon the discourses spoken by the Realized One that are deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness.
sn55.53:2.6: Since we are established in the five training rules, please teach us further.”
sn55.53:3.1: “So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:
sn55.53:3.2: ‘We will have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.53:3.6: And we will have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.’
sn55.53:3.7: That’s how you should train yourselves.”
sn55.53:4.1: “Sir, these four factors of stream-entry that were taught by the Buddha are found in us, and we embody them.
sn55.53:4.2: For we have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.53:4.6: And we have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.”
sn55.53:4.8: You have all declared the fruit of stream-entry.”
